Text: Another Petrobas UpdateA Petrobas press official said there will be gasoline shortages if the strike extends past Sunday However the company has enough gasoline to supply distributors through the weekend FUP has stated the strike will not result in a lack of gasoline diesel and LPG bc Petrobas and other distributors have on avg day stocks The strike has currently reduced oil production by from MMBD to MMBD reduced gas production by from MM cu md to MM cu md and reduced refinery output by from MMBD to MMBD This was reported by Petrobas today Source Reuters Original Message From Koller Ross Sent Friday October AM To Koller Ross Daya Mohamed Carneiro Daniella Chunchu Shilpa Clarke Niamh Cole Jim Costello Zachary Cronin Caroline Glaas Chris Haynes Mark Hill Andrew Thomas John Buckner Jones Mark Mahoney Chris McKinlay Tom OBrien Tony Peter Stewart Potter Darren Roche Ian Shapland Chris Spencer John Talvitie Henkka Wipp Kurt Cc White Bill Nowlan Jr John L Shankman Jeffrey A Goughary Jim Wilson John L Chismar John Subject RE petrobras update our agent just called in to say that the view in the unions is they will vote this weekend to extend the strike past sunday as the only way to twist petrobras arm he says they will not be able to shut down the refs but will lower the wick to the absolute minimum allowed by law which means about a pct reduction in distillate production Original Message From Koller Ross Sent October To Daya Mohamed Carneiro Daniella Chunchu Shilpa Clarke Niamh Cole Jim Costello Zachary Cronin Caroline Glaas Chris Haynes Mark Hill Andrew Thomas John Buckner Jones Mark Koller Ross Mahoney Chris McKinlay Tom OBrien Tony Peter Stewart Potter Darren Roche Ian Shapland Chris Spencer John Talvitie Henkka Wipp Kurt Cc White Bill Nowlan Jr John L Shankman Jeffrey A Goughary Jim Wilson John L Chismar John Subject petrobras update just talked to marcello castilho the head of petrobras office in london he gave me the following their crude production is down by mbd they have crude and product stocks for the next days but then will need to buy initially the thought wud b to buy crude however the situation may have worsened at the refineries he was pessimistic about the discussions said that petrobras called them to a meeting ydy as everyone knows and only upped the ante by pct on their side vs the sought plus the inflation catchup of pct this really angered the unions and they have now said they will not come back to the table before seeing the numbers next time he said petrobras is up against internal competition now from other oil and gas companies who are offering ex petrobras workers a pct increase over their current pay so petrobras is in a poor position so far the refs have been running at very low rates and the managers have not allowed the workers to leave the prmeises but have bunked them and fed them their in hour shifts by law they can only do this for days and some fighting has already broken out at one location so doubtful they can continue the imprisonment much longer if it comes to a bigger showdown he thinks the unions will just shut the refs down on the last shift that they work and he will be buying product not crude

EOL Improvement IdeasHi Jeff I thought this email regarding EOL from Alex would be of interest to you Hess gave them some ideas on how to improve EOL If you need anything please feel free to give me a call at X Thank You Shilpa Original Message From McLeish Alex Sent Friday October AM To Daya Mohamed Carneiro Daniella Chunchu Shilpa Clarke Niamh Cole Jim Costello Zachary Cronin Caroline Glaas Chris Haynes Mark Hill Andrew John Buckner Thomas Email Jones Mark Koller Ross Mahoney Chris McKinlay Tom OBrien Tony Peter Stewart Potter Darren Roche Ian Shapland Chris Spencer John Talvitie Henkka Wipp Kurt Subject Hess views In our lunch with Hess the other day they mentioned a few things of interest regarding EOL They would like to be able to see what has traded like on ICE Theyd like to be able to put in orders even if our prices are not up Keen on the idea of trading settlement and particularly average Would like at the end of the month to square up NXCs They still love EOL they dont even have to write deal tickets for it it goes straight into their system Would dearly love lots on gasoil Asked if we could go round and optimise EOL for them Apart from that didnt express much of a view seemed to be playing it small on flat price
